title: feat: add pcb_copper_text support with knockout and proper mirroring
description: Add support for rendering pcb_copper_text elements in the 3D PCB viewer, implement knockout text feature, fix text mirroring logic, and improve text clarity by increasing texture resolution.
body:
Summary
 
- Add support for rendering `pcb_copper_text` elements in the 3D PCB viewer
- Implement knockout text feature (filled rectangle with text cut out)
- Fix text mirroring logic to match pcb-viewer behavior
- Improve text clarity by increasing texture resolution
 
 Changes
 
 New Features
 
**Copper Text Rendering**

- Renders `pcb_copper_text` circuit JSON elements on both top and bottom layers
- Uses texture-based rendering for visibility at all distances and angles
- Supports all 9-point anchor alignments and CCW rotation
**Knockout Text**

- Draws a filled copper rectangle with text cut out (transparent)
- Configurable padding via `knockout_padding` property
- Supports rotation - rectangle rotates with the text

**Mirroring Logic** (matches pcb-viewer behavior)

- Bottom layer: auto-mirrors text unless `is_mirrored: false`
- Top layer: only mirrors if `is_mirrored: true`

 Improvements
 
- Increased `TRACE_TEXTURE_RESOLUTION` from 50 to 150 pixels/mm for crisper small text
- Removed redundant 3D silkscreen geometry from JSCAD (now uses textures like Manifold)

title: Add packing lifecycle events and improve packing error reporting
description: Adds lifecycle events for packing operations, including error reporting and metadata emission for better debugging and UI integration.
body:
## Summary

- Introduces new lifecycle events: `packing:start`, `packing:end`, and `packing:error`.
- Emits metadata for each event, including `subcircuit_id` and `componentDisplayName`, enabling better UI hooks and debugging.
- Wraps the packing operation in a try/catch to surface errors through `packing:error` before rethrowing.
- Adds `example36` tests and snapshot outputs to verify correct event firing behavior.

title: feat(panel): Refactor grid packing for boards
description: Refactors the panel packing feature to support dynamic grid layouts and custom board outlines, enhancing the handling of boards of varying sizes.
body:
This PR introduces a significant enhancement to the panel packing feature, moving from a simple grid layout to a  
more robust and flexible system. The new implementation properly handles boards of varying sizes, including       
non-rectangular boards defined with an outline.                                                                   

Key features and improvements:                                                                                    

 • Dynamic Grid Layout: The packing algorithm now creates a grid where each column and row automatically resizes  
   to accommodate the largest board within it.                                                                    
 • Outline Support: Boards with custom outline shapes are now correctly measured and packed.                      
 • New Layout Props: The <panel> component now accepts row, col, cellWidth, and cellHeight props for more explicit
   control over the grid dimensions and layout.                                                                   
 • Refactored Logic: The packing logic has been extracted from the Panel component into a new packBoardsIntoGrid  
   utility for better separation of concerns.                                                                     
 • Board Repositioning Fix: The Board component's repositioning logic has been updated to correctly translate its 
   outline when moved, which is critical for panel layouts.                                                       

These changes allow for much more complex and efficient panelization of diverse board shapes.

title: Add Copper Text Rendering and Knockout Support to Gerber Generator
description: Adds full Gerber support for pcb_copper_text, including aperture config, vector text rendering, rotation, mirroring, and anchor alignment, with knockout mode support for proper copper cutout text.
body:
This PR adds full Gerber support for `pcb_copper_text`, including aperture config, vector text rendering, rotation, mirroring, and anchor alignment.
A unified `renderVectorText` function is introduced and used for both silkscreen and copper layers.
Knockout mode is supported via padded region drawing and polarity switching, enabling proper copper cutout text.
Two new snapshot tests validate normal copper text and knockout behavior across top and bottom layers.

title: fix: prevent false obstacle rejection by linking MST sub-routes to parent nets
description: Fixes false obstacle rejection in autorouting by linking Minimum Spanning Tree sub-routes to their parent net identifiers, ensuring valid paths are recognized as connections.
body:
The autorouter was incorrectly rejecting valid paths as "obstacle
  intersections." This happened because when a net was split into Minimum
  Spanning Tree (MST) segments (e.g., net_mst0), the connectivity solver didn't
  link these sub-segments back to the original net name (e.g., net) used by
  destination pads.

  Solution:
   1. Implemented parentNetId property propagation through the entire solver
      pipeline (NetToPointPairsSolver, CapacityPath, SimpleRouteConnection,
      etc.).
   2. Updated ConnectivityMap generation to explicitly link MST sub-routes to
      their parentNetId and mergedConnectionNames.
   3. Removed fragile regex-based name parsing (_mst stripping) in favor of
      this property-based approach.

  This ensures the solver correctly identifies destination pads as valid
  connections, not obstacles.

title: Dynamically load resvg-wasm to fix the initWasm undefined error
description: Fixes GLB export failure in browser due to undefined initWasm when resvgresvg-wasm is externalized in RunFrame.
body: Fix: GLB export failing in browser when @resvg/resvg-wasm is externalized in Runframe Problem GLB export fails in RunFrameForCli (browser) with error: `Failed to initialize WASM: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'initWasm')` Root Cause The static import at the top: `import { Resvg, initWasm } from "@resvg/resvg-wasm"` When this package is externalized in a UMD bundle, the import resolves to undefined because the UMD wrapper expects window.resvgWasm which doesn't exist. Fix Replace static import with dynamic import inside `ensureWasmInitialized()`

title: add the example for interconnect board and remove the circuit json which was being used

The changes include modifications to the SesToCircuitJsonConverter class, where the originalCircuitJson option is removed from the constructor and related functions. Additionally, the PcbTraceCombineStage class has been deleted, which was responsible for combining PCB traces. This simplifies the conversion process and focuses on the new example provided.

title: feat: Add label_side field to schematic_voltage_probe for overlap prevention
description: Adds a label_side field to the SchematicVoltageProbe interface to allow voltage probe labels to be positioned on either side of the arrow, preventing overlaps.
body:
## PR Description

This implementation adds label_side field that enables voltage probe labels to be positioned on either side of the arrow to avoid overlaps

### Changes made
- Added optional `label_side` field ("left" | "right") to SchematicVoltageProbe interface
- Updated zod schema to include label_side validation

### Next Steps

Updating rendering logic in `circuit-to-svg` repo to support flipping the probe

Ref: https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1739

title: feat: Visualize board outlines within panels
description: Adds support for visualizing the outlines of individual boards within a pcb_panel, improving clarity in board placement and shape, and ensures correct property inheritance from boards.
body: This PR introduces support for visualizing the outlines of individual boards within a pcb_panel. Previously, only the panel's outer boundary was rendered as a solid block, making it difficult to discern the placement and shape of the boards inside. This change adds a new texture layer that draws the outlines for each board on both the top and bottom surfaces of the panel. This feature works for both the Manifold and JSCAD rendering engines. Additionally, this PR includes a fix to ensure that when rendering a pcb_panel, it correctly inherits properties like thickness and material from the boards it contains, rather than using hardcoded defaults.

title: add test showing future interconnect feature, fix issues with interconnect not routing
description: Fixes issues with interconnect not routing and adds tests for future interconnect features.

title: feat(panel): Support configurable edge padding props
description: Adds configurable edge padding properties to panel components, allowing for flexible control over the space between auto-arranged boards and the panels edges, while preserving a default 5mm margin if no padding props are supplied.
body:
This introduces configurable edge padding for <panel> components, replacing the 
previously hardcoded DEFAULT_PANEL_MARGIN.                                      

The following props have been added to <panel>:                                 

 • edgePadding                                                                  
 • edgePaddingLeft                                                              
 • edgePaddingRight                                                             
 • edgePaddingTop                                                               
 • edgePaddingBottom                                                            

This allows for more flexible panel layouts by controlling the space between the
auto-arranged boards and the panel's edges. The default behavior of a 5mm margin
is preserved if no padding props are supplied.

title: feat: post merge comment on analysis
description: Adds functionality to post a comment on a pull request after its analysis is completed

title: Enhance ContributorOverview component with scrollable staff section
description: Adds a scrollable section for staff contributors in the ContributorOverview component, improving usability when many contributors are present.

title: Add board support to component offsets
description: Adds support for positioning PCB components relative to the PCB board in SVG generation.

title: feat(pcb): Visualize group-to-group anchor offsets
description: Adds support for visualizing anchor offsets for pcb_group elements that are positioned relative to another pcb_group, extending functionality previously limited to pcb_component elements.
body:
This PR adds support for visualizing anchor offsets for pcb_group elements that are positioned relative to another
pcb_group.                                                                                                        

Previously, anchor offset indicators were only rendered for pcb_component elements. This change extends the       
functionality to pcb_group elements when showAnchorOffsets is enabled, reusing the existing                       
createAnchorOffsetIndicators utility. A new test case has been added to verify the rendering of these             
group-to-group anchor offsets.

title: Fix position_mode: "relative" instead of position_mode: "relative_to_group_anchor", add types
description: Fixes the position_mode from relative to relative_to_group_anchor in PCB components and adds type definitions for better type safety.

title: Handle board-relative anchor offsets
description: Updates circuit-json to the latest version, renders anchor offset indicators for components positioned relative to a PCB board, and adds a PCB test for board-relative offsets and display overrides.
body:
## Summary
- update circuit-json to the latest version
- render anchor offset indicators when components are positioned relative to a PCB board and honor display offset overrides for labels
- add a PCB test covering board-relative offsets and display overrides

## Testing
- bun test tests/pcb/pcb-component-relative-to-board.test.ts
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun run format

title: refactor, setup for solver
description: This pull request introduces a significant refactor of the codebase, particularly focusing on setting up the solver architecture for PCB stitching. It includes the addition of new solver classes, updates to existing modules, and changes to the project structure to accommodate these enhancements. The changes aim to improve the modularity and maintainability of the code, making it easier to implement future features related to circuit design and PCB layout.

title: Add unified Anchor Offset Overlay for boards and groups with improved guards and UI integration
description: This PR adds a unified Anchor Offset Overlay system for boards and groups, allowing board-anchored components to display accurate xy offsets with screen-space markers and labels, while refactoring group overlays for improved detection and UI integration.
body:
This PR introduces a unified Anchor Offset Overlay system with new Board and Group overlays.
Board-anchored components now display Δx/Δy offsets with accurate screen-space markers and labels.
Group overlays were refactored to use shared guards, improved detection, and updated visual constants.
MouseElementTracker now renders both overlays consistently under all transforms.
A new board-anchor fixture demonstrates correct behavior and interactions.
Dependencies and utilities were updated to support the new overlay architecture.

title: Add support for PcbNoteLine
description: Adds support for rendering PCB note lines in the silkscreen texture generation process, including customizable stroke width, color, and dashed line options.

title: Add support for group-to-group and group-to-board PCB relative positioning with display offsets
description: Adds support for explicit PCB positioning of groups using pcbXpcbY, allowing groups to position themselves relative to a parent PCB group or the PCB board, with display offsets stored for groups.
body:
Adds support for explicit PCB positioning of groups using pcbX/pcbY. Groups can now position themselves relative to either a parent PCB group or the PCB board when no parent exists. Display offsets (display_offset_x / display_offset_y) are now stored for groups, matching existing component behavior.

Component-to-group and component-to-board positioning already worked; this PR focuses on enabling group-to-group and group-to-board cases.

Includes new tests covering both new scenarios plus regression tests for existing component behavior. Also updates related @tscircuit/props, circuit-json, and circuit-to-svg versions.

title: remove as any from old anchor offset test
description: Removes the use of any type in tests for anchor offsets, replacing it with a specific type to prevent regressions.

title: pcb: Add anchor offset visualization tests
description: Adds tests for visualizing anchor offsets between PCB components and groups, and between PCB groups and boards.
body:
This PR introduces two new tests to verify anchor offset visualization.                                           

 • Adds a test for visualizing the anchor offset between a pcb_group and a pcb_board.                                                                              
 • Adds a test for visualizing the anchor offset between a pcb_component and a pcb_group.

title: feat: Support NinePointAnchor-based label positioning for voltage probes
description: Adds support for rendering voltage probes with labels at any of 9 anchor positions, adjusts arrow angles and text anchor points based on label alignment, and includes a comprehensive snapshot test for all alignment options.
body: ## PR Description - Added support for rendering voltage probes with labels at any of 9 anchor positions - Flipped arrow angle from -50° to -130° for left-aligned labels (center_left, top_left, bottom_left) - Adjusted text anchor point (end vs start) based on label alignment - Added comprehensive snapshot test covering all alignment options - Updated `circuit-json` dependency version to support `label_alignment` ### Next Steps Implementing automatic voltage probe label overlap detection in `core` Ref: https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1739

body: Before: After:

title: chore: add caching for node_modules in CI workflows
description: Adds caching for node_modules in CI workflows to improve build performance by reducing installation time.

title: fix: improve test reliability with retry logic and increase timeout
description: Increases test timeout from 20s to 30s, implements retry logic for failed tests (up to 3 attempts), and adjusts workflow timeouts in GitHub Actions.
body:
1. `scripts/run-tests-with-retry.ts`  (new file)
- Increases per-test timeout: 20s → 30s
- Retries only the specific failed tests (up to 3 attempts)
- Preserves existing segfault retry logic (up to 4 attempts)
- Cross-platform compatible using  `path.basename()`
2.  `.github/workflows/bun-test.yml`
- Workflow timeout: 15 → 20 minutes
- Uses helper script instead of inline logic
3.  `.github/workflows/windows-tests.yml`
- Workflow timeout: 10 → 15 minutes
- Uses helper script instead of inline logic

title: add some test assets and kicad test script
description: This pull request introduces a new test script for KiCad models and adds test assets, specifically a STEP file. The script automates the process of checking for STEP files in the specified directory and validates them using the parseRepository function. It also includes functionality to clone the KiCad 3D models repository if the directory does not exist.

title: Add copper text canvas rendering with knockout, mirroring, alignment, and snapshot tests
description: This PR adds full canvas-based rendering support for pcb_copper_text, including knockout mode, mirroring, padding, and alignment handling.
body:
This PR adds full canvas-based rendering support for pcb_copper_text, including knockout mode, mirroring, padding, and alignment handling.
A new drawPcbCopperText element implements text measurement, bounding box calculation, and copper-color mapping for all layers.
CircuitToCanvasDrawer now recognizes pcb_copper_text elements and passes them to the new renderer.
Canvas context typing was expanded to support globalCompositeOperation, fillRect, and measureText.
New snapshot tests validate normal copper text and mirrored knockout behavior at different scales.
These additions complete feature parity between SVG and canvas rendering for copper text.
